original: Majjhima Nikāya 72
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Aggivacchasutta
analyzed: aggivacchasutta
translated: With Aggivessana

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  kim nu kho bho gotama sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: After an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Now then, Master Gotama, does the cosmos have an end? Is this alone true, while anything otherwise is worthless?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:🔽‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ  sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  kim pana bho gotama a sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: “Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos has an end.”

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Then does the cosmos not have an end? Is this alone true, while anything otherwise is worthless?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: “Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos does not have an end.” 🔽“Then does the cosmos have an end and not have an end? Is this alone true, while anything otherwise is worthless?”

original: ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
analyzed: a sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘The world is not eternal. This alone is the truth, (all) else is foolish.’

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?🔽“Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:🔽‘antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama antavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti  na kho aha vacchaḥ  antavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘The world is not eternal. Only this is true; anything otherwise is false.’

original: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?🔽“Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama anantavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti  na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: “‘Is it that the world is finite…

original: ‘anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?🔽“Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: anantavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  kim nu kho bho gotama tam jīvam tam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti  na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: that the world is infinite…🔽that the soul and the body are the same thing…

original: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: tam jīvam tam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti 🔽kim pana bho gotama aññam jīvam aññam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: that the soul is one thing and the body another?

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: Is that what you think, Master Gotama?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: “No, Vaccha, I don’t think that.

original: ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: aññam jīvam aññam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  kim nu kho bho gotama hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: I don’t think that the soul is one thing and the body another, and that one thing is made and the other perishable.”

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Well, does Master Gotama think that ‘after death a Tathāgata exists’: ‘Only this is true, anything otherwise is worthless’?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:🔽‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ  hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  kim pana bho gotama na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: “No, Vaccha, I don’t think that.”

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Well, does Master Gotama think that ‘after death a Tathāgata does not exist’: ‘Only this is true, anything otherwise is worthless’?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:🔽‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.🔽“Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ  na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  kim nu kho bho gotama hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: “No, Vaccha, I don’t think that.”🔽“Well, does Master Gotama think that ‘after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist’: ‘Only this is true, anything otherwise is worthless’?”

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “No, Vaccha, I don’t think that.”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: “Vaccha, I don’t hold the view

original: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
analyzed: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: that the Realized One exists after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Well then, does the Realized One not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: na kho aha vacchaḥ
translated: “Vaccha, I don’t hold the view

original: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: that the Realized One does not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless.”🔽“Well then, does the Realized One both exist and not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless?”

original: “‘Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: “Vaccha, I don’t hold the view

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: that the Realized One both exists and does not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless.”🔽“Well then, does the Realized One neither exist nor not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless?”🔽“Vaccha, I don’t hold the view

original: sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.🔽‘Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi 🔽kim pana bho gotama a sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: that the Realized One neither exists nor does not exist after death, that only this is the truth and anything otherwise is worthless.”

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: When asked this, you say, ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos is finite.’🔽‘But do you say that the cosmos is infinite?’

original: asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: a sassataḥ lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: When asked this, you say, ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos is infinite.’

original: ‘Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama antavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: ‘But do you say that the cosmos is both finite and infinite?’

original: antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: antavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: When asked this, you say, ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos is both finite and infinite.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama anantavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: ‘But do you say that the cosmos is neither finite nor infinite?’

original: anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: anantavā lokaḥ idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: When asked this, you say, ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the cosmos is neither finite nor infinite.’

original: ‘Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama tam jīvam tam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘But do you say that the soul and the body are the same thing?’

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: When asked this, you say, ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the soul and the body are the same thing.’

original: taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: tam jīvam tam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: that the soul and the body are the same thing, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama aññam jīvam aññam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: ‘Well then, is it that the soul is one thing and the body another, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion?’

original: aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: aññam jīvam aññam sarīre idam eva saccam mogham aññam ti vadesi
translated: When asked this, you say: ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that the soul is one thing and the body another, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion.’

original: ‘Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—🔽evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti  evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: ‘Well then, does a Realized One exist after death, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion?’

original: hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: hoti tathāgato param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: When asked this, you say: ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that a Realized One exists after death, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘Well then, does a Realized One not exist after death, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion?’

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: When asked this, you say: ‘Vaccha, I don’t say that a Realized One does not exist after death, and this is the only truth while the rest is just delusion.’

original: na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: na hoti tathāgato param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: that after death a Tathāgata does not exist—this alone is the truth, (all) else is foolish.’

original: ‘Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘Well, does it happen that after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist—🔽that you have this view, Gotama?’

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: When asked this, you said: ‘I do not have this view, Vaccha,

original: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: that after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist—this alone is the truth, (all) else is foolish.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—
analyzed: kim pana bho gotama na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: ‘Well, does it happen that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist—🔽that you have this view, Gotama?’

original: evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavaṁ gotamo’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na kho ahaṁ, vaccha, evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: evadiṭṭhi bhavam gotama iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na kho aha vacchaḥ evadiṭṭhi
translated: When asked this, you said: ‘I do not have this view, Vaccha,

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgato param maraṇā idam eva saccam mogham aññanti vadesi
translated: that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist—this alone is the truth, (all) else is foolish.’

original: Kiṁ pana bho gotamo ādīnavaṁ sampassamāno evaṁ imāni sabbaso diṭṭhigatāni anupagato”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bho gotamaḥ ādīnavam sampassamānaḥ evam imāni sabbaso diṭṭhi gatāni an upagataḥ ti
translated: But what danger do you see, Gotama, that you have not given up all of these views?”

original: “‘Sassato loko’ti kho, vaccha, diṭṭhigatametaṁ diṭṭhigahanaṁ diṭṭhikantāro diṭṭhivisūkaṁ🔽diṭṭhivipphanditaṁ diṭṭhisaṁyojanaṁ sadukkhaṁ savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ,🔽na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na
analyzed: sassataḥ lokaḥ ti kho vaccha diṭṭhi gatam etam diṭṭhi gahanam diṭṭhi kantāraḥ diṭṭhi visūka  diṭṭhi vipphanditam diṭṭhi sayojanam sa dukkham sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha  na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na
translated: ‘Vaccha, the view “the world is eternal” is an ensnarement of views, a wilderness of views, a writhing of views, a fetter of views.🔽It leads to harm, despair, and unhappiness; it is not the way to liberation from bonds, to the right ending of stress, to complete awakening, to complete unbinding.

original: nibbānāya saṁvattati.🔽‘Asassato loko’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: nibbānāya savattati  a sassataḥ lokaḥ ti kho vaccha pe
translated: It does not lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, calm, higher knowledge, complete awakening, or complete unbinding.🔽‘The view “the world is not eternal” is an ensnarement of views…

original: ‘antavā loko’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: kho vaccha pe
translated: ‘The view “the world is finite” is an ensnarement of views…

original: ‘anantavā loko’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: kho vaccha pe  tam jīvam tam kho vaccha pe
translated: ‘The view “the world is infinite” is an ensnarement of views…🔽‘The view “the soul and the body are the same” is an ensnarement of views…

original: ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha …pe…🔽‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: aññam jīvam aññam sarīran ti kho vaccha pe  hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe  na hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe
translated: ‘The view “the soul is one thing and the body another” is an ensnarement of views…🔽‘The view “after death a Tathāgata exists” is an ensnarement of views…🔽‘The view “after death a Tathāgata does not exist” is an ensnarement of views…

original: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha …pe…
analyzed: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgataḥ param kho vaccha pe
translated: ‘The view “after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist” is an ensnarement of views…

original: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, vaccha, diṭṭhigatametaṁ diṭṭhigahanaṁ🔽diṭṭhikantāro diṭṭhivisūkaṁ diṭṭhivipphanditaṁ diṭṭhisaṁyojanaṁ sadukkhaṁ savighātaṁ🔽saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ, na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgato param kho vaccha diṭṭhi gatam etam diṭṭhi gahana  diṭṭhi kantāraḥ diṭṭhi visūkam diṭṭhi vipphanditam diṭṭhi sayojanam sa dukkham sa vighāta  sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya
translated: ‘A perfected one does not exist after death,’ this is a view based on the special qualities of the self,🔽a thicket of views, a wilderness of views, a contortion of views, a writhing of views, a fetter of views. It is accompanied by suffering, distress, despair, and fever, and it does not lead to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, or Nibbāna.🔽

original: na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati
translated: ‘A Tathāgata does not exist after death,’ this is a thicket of views, a wilderness of views, a contortion of views, a writhing of views, a fetter of views. It is accompanied by suffering, distress, despair, and fever, and it does not lead to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, or Nibbāna.

original: Imaṁ kho ahaṁ, vaccha, ādīnavaṁ sampassamāno evaṁ imāni sabbaso diṭṭhigatāni anupagato”ti.
analyzed: imam kho aha vaccha ādīnavam sampassamānaḥ evam imāni sabbasas diṭṭhi gatāni an upagataḥ ti
translated: “Vaccha, seeing this danger, I have not fallen into any of these views.”

original: “Atthi pana bhoto gotamassa kiñci diṭṭhigatan”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana bhoto gotamassa kiñci diṭṭhigatanti
translated: “But does Master Gotama have any view at all?”

original: “Diṭṭhigatanti kho, vaccha, apanītametaṁ tathāgatassa.
analyzed: diṭṭhi gatam ti kho vaccha apanītam etam tathāgatassa
translated: “Vaccha, ‘view’ is something the Tathāgata has done away with.

original: Diṭṭhañhetaṁ, vaccha, tathāgatena:
analyzed: diṭṭhan heta vaccha tathāgatena
translated: The Tathāgata has seen this:

original: ‘iti rūpaṁ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
analyzed: iti rūpa iti rūpassa samudayaḥ iti rūpassa atthaṅgamaḥ
translated: ‘This is form, this is the origination of form, this is the cessation of form;

original: iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo;
analyzed: iti vedanā iti vedanāya samudayaḥ iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo
translated: this is feeling, this is the origination of feeling, this is the cessation of feeling;

original: iti saññā, iti saññāya samudayo, iti saññāya atthaṅgamo;
analyzed: iti saññā iti saññāya samudayaḥ iti saññāya atthaṅgamo
translated: This is perception, this is the origination of perception, this is the ending of perception;

original: iti saṅkhārā, iti saṅkhārānaṁ samudayo, iti saṅkhārānaṁ atthaṅgamo;
analyzed: iti saṅkhārāḥ iti samudayaḥ iti saṅkhārānaṃ atthaṅgamo
translated: This is volition, this is the origination of volition, this is the ending of volition;

original: iti viññāṇaṁ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti.
analyzed: iti viññāṇaḥ iti viññāṇassa samudayaḥ iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: This is consciousness, this is the origination of consciousness, this is the ending of consciousness.’

original: Tasmā tathāgato sabbamaññitānaṁ sabbamathitānaṁ sabbaahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānānusayānaṁ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā anupādā vimuttoti vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: tasmā tathāgataḥ sabba maññitānam sabba mathitānam sabba ahaṅkāra mamaṅkāra māna anusayānam khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā anupādā vimuttaḥ iti vadāmi iti
translated: That is why I say that the Tathagata, with the destruction, fading away, cessation, giving up, relinquishment, and letting go of all conceivings, all reckonings, all obsessions with mental proliferation, all latent tendencies, all underlying tendencies, all adorning and all clinging, is liberated in the destruction of clinging.”

original: “Evaṁ vimuttacitto pana, bho gotama, bhikkhu kuhiṁ upapajjatī”ti?
analyzed: evam vimutta cittaḥ pana bho gotama bhikkhu kuhim upapajjati iti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, where does a bhikkhu who is thus liberated reappear?”

original: “Upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upeti”.
analyzed: upapajjati iti kho vaccha naḥ upeti
translated: “Vaccha, it is not tenable to say that he reappears.”

original: “Tena hi, bho gotama, na upapajjatī”ti?
analyzed: tena hi bho gotama naḥ upapajjati iti
translated: “Then, Master Gotama, does he not reappear?”

original: “Na upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upeti”.
analyzed: na upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti
translated: “Vaccha, it is not tenable to say that he does not reappear.”

original: “Tena hi, bho gotama, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatī”ti?
analyzed: tena hi bho gotama upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti
translated: “Then, Master Gotama, does he both reappear and not reappear?”

original: “Upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upeti”.
analyzed: upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti
translated: “Vaccha, it is not tenable to say that he both reappears and does not reappear.”

original: “Tena hi, bho gotama, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatī”ti?
analyzed: tena hi bho gotama na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti
translated: “Well then, Master Gotama, he neither reappears nor does he not reappear?”

original: “Neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upeti”.
analyzed: na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti
translated: “Vaccha, it is not tenable to say, ‘He neither reappears nor does he not reappear.’”

original: “‘Evaṁ vimuttacitto pana, bho gotama, bhikkhu kuhiṁ upapajjatī’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upetī’ti vadesi.
analyzed: evam vimutta cittaḥ pana bho gotama bhikkhu kuhim upapajjati iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti iti vadesi
translated: “When asked, ‘Master Gotama, where does a bhikkhu who has thus completely destroyed the taints come to be re-born?’ you say, ‘Vaccha, it is not tenable to say, “He comes to be re-born.”’

original: ‘Tena hi, bho gotama, na upapajjatī’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘na upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upetī’ti vadesi.🔽‘Tena hi, bho gotama, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatī’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upetī’ti vadesi.
analyzed: tena hi bho gotama na upapajjati iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti iti vadesi  tena hi bho gotama upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti iti vadesi
translated: When asked, ‘Well then, Master Gotama, does he not come to be re-born?’ you say, ‘Vaccha, it is not tenable to say, “He does not come to be re-born.”’🔽When asked, ‘Well then, Master Gotama, does he both come to be re-born and not come to be re-born?’ you say, ‘Vaccha, it is not tenable to say, “He both comes to be re-born and does not come to be re-born.”’

original: ‘Tena hi, bho gotama, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatī’ti iti puṭṭho samāno ‘neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti kho, vaccha, na upetī’ti vadesi.
analyzed: tena hi bho gotama na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti kho vaccha na upeti iti vadesi
translated: When asked, ‘Well then, Master Gotama, does he neither come to be re-born nor not come to be re-born?’ you say, ‘Vaccha, it is not tenable to say, “He neither comes to be re-born nor does he not come to be re-born.”’🔽“

original: Etthāhaṁ, bho gotama, aññāṇamāpādiṁ, ettha sammohamāpādiṁ.
analyzed: ettha āha bho gotama aññāṇam āpādi ettha sammoham āpādi
translated: I was confused about that, Master Gotama.

original: Yāpi me esā bhoto gotamassa purimena kathāsallāpena ahu pasādamattā sāpi me etarahi antarahitā”ti.
analyzed: yā api me esā bhotaḥ gotamassa purimena kathā sallāpena ahu pasāda mattā sā api me etarahi antarahitā ati
translated: And the slight confidence I had in Master Gotama has now disappeared.”

original: “Alañhi te, vaccha, aññāṇāya, alaṁ sammohāya.
analyzed: alam hi te vaccha aññāṇāya alam sammohāya
translated: “It’s no wonder you’re confused, Vaccha.

original: Gambhīro hāyaṁ, vaccha, dhammo duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
analyzed: gambhīraḥ hāya vaccha dhammaḥ duddasaḥ duranubodhaḥ santaḥ paṇītaḥ a takka avacaraḥ nipuṇaḥ paṇḍita vedanīyo
translated: This matter is profound, Vaccha, hard to see and hard to understand, peaceful and sublime, beyond the sphere of logic, subtle, to-be-experienced by the wise.

original: So tayā dujjāno aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrayogena aññatrācariyakena.
analyzed: so tayā dujjānaḥ añña diṭṭhikena añña khantikena añña rucikena añña trayogena aññatra ācariyakena
translated: It’s hard for you to know this matter, Vaccha, since you hold a different view, adopt a different practice, approve of a different practice, have a different teacher, and go by a different teacher.

original: Tena hi, vaccha, taññevettha paṭipucchissāmi; yathā te khameyya tathā naṁ byākareyyāsi.
analyzed: tena hi vaccha tañca eva ittha paṭipucchissāmi yathā te khameyya tathā nam byākareyyāsi
translated: So, Vaccha, I will counter-question you on this matter, and you can reply as you like.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, vaccha,🔽sace te purato aggi jaleyya, jāneyyāsi tvaṁ:
analyzed: tam kim maññasi vaccha  sace te puratas aggi jaleyya jāneyyāsi tva
translated: What do you think, Vaccha?

original: ‘ayaṁ me purato aggi jalatī’”ti?🔽“Sace me, bho gotama, purato aggi jaleyya, jāneyyāhaṁ:
analyzed: ayam me puratas aggi jalati iti  sace me bho gotama puratas aggi jaleyya jāneyya āha
translated: If a fire were burning in front of you, would you know that ‘This fire is burning in front of me’?”

original: ‘ayaṁ me purato aggi jalatī’”ti.
analyzed: ayam me puratas aggi jalati iti
translated: “If a fire were burning in front of me, Master Gotama, I would know that ‘This fire is burning in front of me.’”

original: “Sace pana taṁ, vaccha, evaṁ puccheyya:
analyzed: sace pana te vacchaḥ evam puccheyya
translated: “But if you were asked:

original: ‘yo te ayaṁ purato aggi jalati ayaṁ aggi kiṁ paṭicca jalatī’ti, evaṁ puṭṭho tvaṁ, vaccha, kinti byākareyyāsī”ti?
analyzed: yaḥ te ayam puratas aggi jalati ayam aggi kim paṭicca jalati iti evam puṭṭhaḥ tva vaccha kinti byākareyyāsi iti
translated: ‘The fire burning in front of you, what is it dependent on to burn?’ how would you answer?”

original: “Sace maṁ, bho gotama, evaṁ puccheyya:🔽‘yo te ayaṁ purato aggi jalati ayaṁ aggi kiṁ paṭicca jalatī’ti, evaṁ puṭṭho ahaṁ, bho gotama, evaṁ byākareyyaṁ:
analyzed: sace mā bho gotamaḥ evam puccheyya  yaḥ te ayam puratas aggi jalati ayam aggi kim paṭicca jalati iti evam puṭṭhaḥ aha bho gotamaḥ evam byākareyya
translated: “If I was asked that, I would answer:

original: ‘yo me ayaṁ purato aggi jalati ayaṁ aggi tiṇakaṭṭhupādānaṁ paṭicca jalatī’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ me ayam puratas aggi jalati ayam aggi tiṇa kaṭṭhupādānam paṭicca jalati iti
translated: ‘The fire burning in front of me is dependent on fuel to burn.’”

original: “Sace te, vaccha, purato so aggi nibbāyeyya, jāneyyāsi tvaṁ:
analyzed: sace te vaccha puratas saḥ aggi nibbāyeyya jāneyyāsi tva
translated: “If the fire in front of you was to go out, would you know:

original: ‘ayaṁ me purato aggi nibbuto’”ti?
analyzed: ayam me puratas aggi nibbutaḥ ti
translated: ‘The fire in front of me has gone out’?”

original: “Sace me, bho gotama, purato so aggi nibbāyeyya, jāneyyāhaṁ:
analyzed: sace me bho gotama puratas saḥ aggi nibbāyeyya jāneyya āha
translated: “If the fire in front of me was to go out, I would know:

original: ‘ayaṁ me purato aggi nibbuto’”ti.
analyzed: ayam me puratas aggi nibbutaḥ ti
translated: ‘The fire in front of me has gone out.’”

original: “Sace pana taṁ, vaccha, evaṁ puccheyya:
analyzed: sace pana te vacchaḥ evam puccheyya
translated: “But if you were asked:

original: ‘yo te ayaṁ purato aggi nibbuto so aggi ito katamaṁ disaṁ gato—
analyzed: yaḥ te ayam puratas aggi nibbutaḥ saḥ aggi itas katamam disam gataḥ
translated: ‘The fire that has gone out in front of you, which direction has it gone to—

original: puratthimaṁ vā dakkhiṇaṁ vā pacchimaṁ vā uttaraṁ vā’ti, evaṁ puṭṭho tvaṁ, vaccha, kinti byākareyyāsī”ti?
analyzed: puratthimam vā dakkhiṇam vā pacchimam vā uttaram vā ati evam puṭṭhaḥ kinti byākareyyāsi iti
translated: east, west, north, or south?”

original: “Na upeti, bho gotama, yañhi so, bho gotama, aggi tiṇakaṭṭhupādānaṁ paṭicca ajali tassa ca pariyādānā aññassa ca anupahārā anāhāro nibbutotveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchatī”ti.
analyzed: na upeti bho gotama yat hi saḥ bho gotama aggi tiṇa kaṭṭhupādānam paṭicca ca pariyādānā aññassa ca anupahārā anāhāraḥ nibbutaḥ tu eva saṅkhyam gacchati iti
translated: “No, Master Gotama. For that fire would be reckoned as extinguished because of the exhaustion of the original fuel, and because no other fuel would be brought.”

original: “Evameva kho, vaccha, yena rūpena tathāgataṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya taṁ rūpaṁ tathāgatassa pahīnaṁ ucchinnamūlaṁ tālāvatthukataṁ anabhāvaṅkataṁ āyatiṁ anuppādadhammaṁ.🔽Rūpasaṅkhayavimutto kho, vaccha, tathāgato gambhīro appameyyo duppariyogāḷho—
analyzed: evam eva kho vaccha yena rūpena tathāgatam paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya tam rūpam tathāgatassa pahīnam ucchinna mūlam tālāvatthukatam anabhāvaṅkatam āyatim an uppāda dhamma  rūpa saṅkhaya vimuttaḥ kho vaccha tathāgataḥ gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ duppariyogāḷhaḥ
translated: “So too, Vaccha, whatever form the Tathāgata has had in the past, whether in terms of character or bodily form, that the Tathāgata has abandoned, its root destroyed, made like a palmyra stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising.

original: seyyathāpi mahāsamuddo.
analyzed: seyyathā api mahā samuddaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, freed from the classification of form, is deep, boundless, hard to fathom, like the ocean.🔽He is deep in wisdom, deep in knowledge, deep in vision, deep in eloquence, deep in liberation.

original: Upapajjatīti na upeti, na upapajjatīti na upeti, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti na upeti, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti na upeti.
analyzed: upapajjati iti na upeti na upapajjati iti na upeti upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti na upeti na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti na upeti
translated: He is not subject to rebirth, nor does he not exist after death. He is not subject to both, nor is he not subject to both.

original: Yāya vedanāya tathāgataṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya sā vedanā tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: yāya vedanāya tathāgatam paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya sā vedanā tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: Whatever feeling the Tathāgata experiences, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, he remains unmoved, with mindfulness fully established and his heart purified of desire and discontent.

original: Vedanāsaṅkhayavimutto kho, vaccha, tathāgato gambhīro appameyyo duppariyogāḷho—🔽seyyathāpi mahāsamuddo.
analyzed: vedanā saṅkhaya vimuttaḥ kho vaccha tathāgataḥ gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ duppariyogāḷhaḥ  seyyathā api mahā samuddaḥ
translated: “Vaccha, the Tathāgata is liberated from reckoning in terms of ‘arises’ and ‘perishes.’ He is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.🔽“He is liberated from reckoning in terms of ‘arises’ and ‘perishes.’ He is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.

original: Upapajjatīti na upeti, na upapajjatīti na upeti, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti na upeti, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti na upeti.🔽Yāya saññāya tathāgataṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya sā saññā tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: upapajjati iti na upeti na upapajjati iti na upeti upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti na upeti na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti na upeti  yāya saññāya tathāgatam paññāpayamānaḥ paññāpeyya sā saññā tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: “He is liberated from reckoning in terms of ‘arises’ and ‘perishes.’ He is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.🔽“He is liberated from reckoning in terms of ‘arises’ and ‘perishes.’ He is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.

original: Saññāsaṅkhayavimutto kho, vaccha, tathāgato gambhīro appameyyo duppariyogāḷho—🔽seyyathāpi mahāsamuddo.
analyzed: saññā saṅkhaya vimuttaḥ kho vaccha tathāgataḥ gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ duppariyogāḷhaḥ 🔽seyyathā api mahā samuddaḥ
translated: “He is liberated from reckoning in terms of ‘arises’ and ‘perishes.’ He is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.

original: Upapajjatīti na upeti, na upapajjatīti na upeti, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti na upeti, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti na upeti.
analyzed: upapajjati iti na upeti na upapajjati iti na upeti upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti na upeti na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti na upeti
translated: He does not approach ‘he reappears’ or ‘he does not reappear’ or ‘he both reappears and does not reappear’ or ‘he neither reappears nor does not reappear.’

original: Yehi saṅkhārehi tathāgataṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya te saṅkhārā tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: yehi saṅkhārehi tathāgatam paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya te saṅkhārā tathāgatassa pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned, cut off at the root, made a withered stump, so that it is no longer subject to future arising, those processes by which one describing the Tathāgata might describe him.

original: Saṅkhārasaṅkhayavimutto kho, vaccha, tathāgato gambhīro appameyyo duppariyogāḷho—
analyzed: saṅkhāra saṅkhaya vimuttaḥ kho vaccha tathāgataḥ gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ duppariyogāḷhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, Vaccha, is liberated through the destruction of craving, is deep, immeasurable, hard to fathom,

original: seyyathāpi mahāsamuddo.
analyzed: seyyathā api mahā samuddaḥ
translated: like the ocean.

original: Upapajjatīti na upeti, na upapajjatīti na upeti, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti na upeti, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti na upeti.
analyzed: upapajjati iti na upeti na upapajjati iti na upeti upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti na upeti na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti na upeti
translated: He does not approach ‘he reappears’ or ‘he does not reappear’ or ‘he both reappears and does not reappear’ or ‘he neither reappears nor does not reappear.’

original: Yena viññāṇena tathāgataṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya taṁ viññāṇaṁ tathāgatassa pahīnaṁ ucchinnamūlaṁ tālāvatthukataṁ anabhāvaṅkataṁ āyatiṁ anuppādadhammaṁ.
analyzed: yena viññāṇena tathāgatam paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya tam viññāṇam tathāgatassa pahīnam ucchinna mūlam tālāvatthukatam anabhāvaṅkatam āyatim an uppāda dhamma
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned, cut off at the root, made a withered stump, so that it is no longer subject to future arising, that consciousness by which one describing the Tathāgata might describe him.

original: Viññāṇasaṅkhayavimutto kho, vaccha, tathāgato gambhīro appameyyo duppariyogāḷho—
analyzed: viññāṇa saṅkhaya vimuttaḥ kho vaccha tathāgataḥ gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ duppariyogāḷhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is liberated through the destruction of craving, and he is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.

original: seyyathāpi mahāsamuddo.
analyzed: seyyathā api mahā samuddaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is liberated through the destruction of craving, and he is deep, boundless, hard-to-fathom, like the ocean.🔽He is not easy to discern

original: Upapajjatīti na upeti, na upapajjatīti na upeti, upapajjati ca na ca upapajjatīti na upeti, neva upapajjati na na upapajjatīti na upetī”ti.
analyzed: upapajjati iti na upeti na upapajjati iti na upeti upapajjati ca na ca upapajjati iti na upeti na iva upapajjati na na upapajjati iti na upeti iti
translated: with the thought: ‘He is reborn’ or ‘He is not reborn’ or ‘He is both reborn and not reborn’ or ‘He is neither reborn nor not reborn.’“

original: Evaṁ vutte, vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Blessed One:

original: “seyyathāpi, bho gotama, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahāsālarukkho.
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahā sāla rukkhaḥ
translated: “Suppose, Master Gotama, not far from a village or town there was a great sāla tree.

original: Tassa aniccatā sākhāpalāsā palujjeyyuṁ, tacapapaṭikā palujjeyyuṁ, pheggū palujjeyyuṁ;🔽so aparena samayena apagatasākhāpalāso apagatatacapapaṭiko apagataphegguko suddho assa, sāre patiṭṭhito;
analyzed: tassa anicca tā sākhāpalāsā palujjeyyu taca papaṭikā palujjeyyu pheggū palujjeyyu  saḥ aparena samayena apagata sākhāpalāsaḥ apagata taca papaṭikaḥ apagata pheggukaḥ suddhaḥ assa sāre patiṭṭhito
translated: Its branches and foliage would die back, its bark would peel off, and its softwood would rot away.🔽But after some time it would be left with only the heartwood,

original: evameva bhoto gotamassa pāvacanaṁ apagatasākhāpalāsaṁ apagatatacapapaṭikaṁ apagatapheggukaṁ suddhaṁ, sāre patiṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva bhoto gotamassa pāvacanam apagata sākhā palāsam apagata taca papaṭikam apagata pheggukam suddha sāre patiṭṭhita
translated: so too, Master Gotama’s doctrine and discipline is left with only the heartwood, stripped of the branches and leaves, stripped of the bark, stripped of the softwood.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe
translated: Excellent, Master Gotama! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: Aggivacchasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: aggivaccha suttam niṭṭhitam dutiya
translated: The Second Portion for Repeating is finished.
